[#OSDE_0.2.8]

=Introduction=

There are three general operation systems to test. <br />
Windows XP, Windows Vista and Linux.<br />
See issues <a href="http://code.google.com/p/opensocial-development-environment/issues/detail?id=49">49</a>, <a href="http://code.google.com/p/opensocial-development-environment/issues/detail?id=50">50</a>, <a href="http://code.google.com/p/opensocial-development-environment/issues/detail?id=51">51</a>.

This page is used to describe what items need to test.<br />
You should define items here before test, <br />
or test by items described here to be familiar with OSDE.

Moreover, you can write anything should test but not described here,<br />
or even any improvement on next generation OSDE if you're responsible for it.

== Windows XP==

===(C) Common features to be tested in Windows XP ===
====Common features that will be Implemented and Tested for OSDE 0.2.8 release ====

  * A built in Shindig server for local testing and debugging.
  * An integrated database based on the Java H2 for storing and managing social data.
  * Simple project and gadget code generation wizards to quickly generate your [http://code.google.com/intl/zh-TW/apis/opensocial/ OpenSocial] application projects and application code.
  * A multi-paned gadget spec editor that facilitates productive gadget development.
  * A new "[http://code.google.com/intl/zh-TW/apis/opensocial/ OpenSocial]" Eclipse perspective that provides enhanced editing and debugging with easy access and control of the local Shindig and social database.
  * An [http://code.google.com/intl/zh-TW/apis/opensocial/ OpenSocial] REST Java client wizard that can quickly generate a new project along with sample code that uses the [http://code.google.com/intl/zh-TW/apis/opensocial/ OpenSocial] RESTful Java client library to connect to the local OpenSocial server.
